questions.text: One of the following is not a defence in case of criminal negligence
questions.solution: Contributory negligence can be a defence only in civil cases, not in criminal cases.

questions.text: Warning notice is issued to a doctor for
questions.solution: Warning notice is nothing but the code of conduct for doctors prescribed by the Medical Council/commission, which is issued to all the doctors at the time of registration.

questions.text: A child of 8 years will have ____ permanent and ____ temporary teeth
questions.solution:
Permanent teeth = (Age - 5) x 4 and Temporary teeth = 24 - permanent teeth.

(Total number of teeth during mixed dentition is 24).

Permanent teeth = (8 - 5) x 4 = 3 x 4 = 12

Temporary teeth = 24 - 1 2 = 12.

questions.text: Scaphocephaly results from premature closure of
questions.solution: Premature closure of sagittal suture give rise to elongation of cranium, known as scaphocephaly.

questions.text: Keyhole defect is a feature of
questions.solution: Keyhole defect may be seen in skull when the skull is hit by a bullet at an angle.

questions.text: After a building collapse, among remnants, a person's length of humerus is 24.5 cm. What is the predicted height of the individual
questions.solution: Multiplication factor for humerus to estimate stature is 5.3. (24.5 x 5.3 = 129.85).

questions.text: Procurator Fiscal system is followed in

choices.text: The one he received the summons earlier

questions.text: If a witness receives two summonses to attend on the same day by the following courts, he has to attend
questions.solution: The higher court must be given preference over lower court. Sessions court is higher than CJM court.

choices.text: Medical evidence of injury as witness
Evidence of medical expert in lower court

questions.text: All are exempted from oral testimony EXCEPT
questions.solution: Medico-legal reports are accepted in a Court of law - only after cross examination, unless the opposite lawyer is willing to accept without cross examination. Once the evidence is deposited in a lower court, no need to deposit same evidence in a higher court. Chemical examiner is exempted. Dead person cannot be called.

questions.text: Only permanent cavity is seen in gunshot injury with
questions.solution: Low velocity bullets cause only a permanent cavity due to crushing of tissues.

questions.text: A pencil has entered into the palm and come out on the dorsum of hand. The injury is termed as:
questions.solution: Pencil is a blunt pointed object; the external wound looks like a lacerated wound. A stab wound with wound of entry and wound of exit is known as perforated wound.

questions.text: Only blackening and tattooing in pistol are seen in
questions.solution: In near shot, the victim is beyond the reach of the flame, but within the reach of soot and powder particles. So that, one can see only blackening and tattooing.

questions.text: Satellite wounds in a smooth bored firearm wound is seen at a distance of
questions.solution: In case of smooth bored firearm, up to the range of 2 meters there will be a single wound of entry; between 2 and 4 metres, there will be a main wound of entry + satellite wounds and beyond 4 meters there will be multiple wounds of entry.

questions.text: Inhalation burn include all EXCEPT
questions.solution: Inhalation burn will not cause singeing of hair. The oxides of nitrogen may cause sputum into yellow. Lack of oxygen causes hypoxia. Hoarseness of voice may be due to injury to laryngeal mucosa by hot air inhalation.

questions.text: A resident doctor used the same needle for two patients while giving antibiotics. Following which the patient became HIV+. This act of gross medical negligence is punishable under
questions.solution: Negligent Act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life.

questions.text: A person is held responsible for his acts done under following condition
questions.solution: It is the responsibility of the person undergoing hypnosis to select a right hypnotist! In delirium, epileptic aura and automatism, the person is totally unaware.

questions.text: Sexual intercourse by a husband with his wife during separation without wife's consent is punishable under Section
questions.solution: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation. Whoever has sexual intercourse with his own wife, who is living separately, whether under a decree of separation or otherwise, without her consent, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than two years but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

questions.text: The reason for marbling is
questions.solution: Hb combines with H2S and forms SulphHb, which stain the venous wall.

choices.text: Stab wound by a kitchen knife

questions.text: ‘Fish tailing‘ may be seen in
questions.solution: Sometimes, the blunt edge of the single edged knife may tear the skin in the shape of the tail of the fish, known as ‘fish tailing’.

choices.text: Greenish discoloration of under surface of liver
Reddish brown discoloration of intima of aorta

questions.text: First internal sign of putrefaction is
Most likely injury in SBS is
questions.solution: Jolting movement of the head may give rise to rupture of bridging veins.

choices.text: Sexual intercourse with a girl < 18 years with consent

questions.text: One of the following is not punishable in India
questions.solution: Incest per se is not punishable in India unless it amounts to rape.

questions.text: For DNA testing, which tissue sample is taken in an autopsy
questions.solution: Muscle > Spleen

questions.text: A dead body with gunshot wound is brought to the mortuary. On examination, there was a wound of entry with abrasion collar & inverted margins surrounded by tattooing without burning and blackening. The range of firing is
questions.solution: Intermediate range means, the victim is beyond the range of the reach of the flame and soot, but within the range of the reach of the powder particles.

questions.text: Adduction fracture of hyoid bone maybe seen in
questions.solution: The pressure by the fingertips and finger pulps over the greater cornu of the hyoid bone may cause fracture in about 30-50% of cases of throttling. The fractured ends are displaced inwards which is known as adduction fracture or inward compression fracture.

questions.text: The hymen which mimics torn hymen is
questions.solution: In fimbriated hymen there are multiple notches; asymmetrical, which mimics torn hymen but do not touch the vaginal wall

questions.text: According to the F.D.I. Formula, the tooth that is denoted by the numbers '34' is
questions.solution: In F.D.I. formula, the first letter denotes the quadrant number (For permanent teeth, 1 is upper right, 2 is upper left, 3 is lower left and 4 is lower right quadrants) and the second letter denotes the tooth number (Teeth are numbered from 1 to 8 from medial to lateral; 4 denotes first bicuspid).

questions.text: Abrasion collar helps to know
questions.solution: In case of perpendicular entry, the abrasion collar will be circular and in case of tangential entry, it is ovoid.

questions.text: Force applied tangentially cause
questions.solution: Force applied perpendicularly cause split laceration, applied tangentially cause stretch laceration, applied almost horizontally cause avulsion laceration and applied irregularly cause tear.

questions.text: Edema acquosum occurs in
questions.solution: In case of Edema acquosum, there is edema of the lung with minimal froth which is seen in Submersion of an unconscious person.

questions.text: Which of the following act as direct poison?
questions.solution: Metals per se are not poisonous, except Lead; only the compounds of metals are poisonous.

questions.text: A quack injects penicillin after giving test dose. But the patient dies of anaphylactic shock. The quack can defend on the grounds of
questions.solution: A quack is a non-medical person and he does not have any rights to inject penicillin

questions.text: A man was found with suicidal shot on right temple. The gun was in his right hand. The skull was burst open, there was charring and cherry red coloration in the track inside. What can be said about the shot?
questions.solution: The enormous amount of gases resulted in bursting out of the skull as in cases of Kronlein shot which may be seen in contact shots & high velocity rifled weapons.

questions.text: Satellite wounds are seen in case of shogun injuries in
questions.solution: Satellite wounds are seen when the target is at 2-4 meters; also known as intermediate range.

questions.text: A junior surgeon has performed appendectomy and leaves an artery forceps in the abdomen in a hospital where he has been appointed. The patent files a case in a court of law. Who is responsible for the damages?
questions.solution: As per respondeat superior, the employer is held liable for employee's negligent acts and he must pay the damages (compensation).

questions.text: Exceptions to informed consent includes all the following except
questions.solution: Section 30 BNS. Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without con­sent.—Nothing is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause to a person for whose benefit it is done in good faith, even without that person’s consent, if the circumstances are such that it is impossible for that person to signify consent, or if that person is incapable of giving consent, and has no guardian or other person in lawful charge of him from whom it is possible to obtain consent in time for the thing to be done with benefit.

questions.text: 'Swallow tails' may be seen in
questions.solution: In lacerated wounds, tearing at the ends at angles diverging from the main one is known as swallow tail.

questions.text: Bullet fingerprinting is
questions.solution: Secondary markings are also known as Individual characteristics or bullet fingerprinting.

questions.text: Suggestive of ante-mortem death in burns is
questions.solution: The definite signs of death due to burns are: 1. Presence of soot in trachea, 2. Presence of blisters containing albumin, RBCs, WBCs & chloride with red line at the periphery and 3. More than 10% carboxy hemoglobin in the blood.

questions.text: The muscles not stiff in lower limbs, P.M. lividity not blanching on pressure; the P.M. interval is
questions.solution: Rigor mortis not fully established (<12 hours), and PM lividity is fixed (>6 hours)

questions.text: Preservation of brain is not required in
questions.solution: The heavy metals get deposited in skin, nails, bone, muscle and hair. Not in the brain.

questions.text: Minimum age of a person who can give consent for age determination is
questions.solution: Age can be determined not only by the physical and dental examination, but also by radiological examination (to see the appearance and fusion of ossification centres) for which minimum age to give consent is 18 years

questions.text: Embalming without consent is punishable under
questions.solution: 301 BNS deals with indignity to human corpse.

questions.text: Which of the following bullets cause greater damage to the tissues?
questions.solution: Dum dum bullet mushrooms out on hitting the target and give rise to greater tissue damage.

questions.text: Large irregular entrance wound is seen in
questions.solution: In case of contact shots over head, the splitting of skin takes place, the wound will be irregular and larger in size.

choices.text: At any time before full term

questions.text: Legally, abortion means - termination of pregnancy
questions.solution: As per law, abortion means, Expulsion of products of conception at any time before full term.

choices.text: Becoming father of the baby of the patient
One's own rights on his body
Disrespecting the rights of a person

questions.text: Paternalism means
In India marital rape is
questions.solution: In India, there is nothing like marital rape.

choices.text: The convulsions are first clonic and eventually tonic
Duration of rigor mortis is longer
All muscles are affected at same time
Between fits muscles are completely relaxed

questions.text: Features of strychnine poisoning are all, except?
questions.solution: In case of strychnine poisoning, the rigor mortis starts early and passes off quickly.

questions.text: One of the following poisonings can be diagnosed by slit lamp examination
questions.solution: Mercury gets deposited in the anterior lens capsule, known as 'Brown malt reflex' or 'Mercuria lentis' which can be diagnosed by slit lamp examination.
